title: The pigeon rescuer of the Gowanus Expressway
brief: A captivating photo story unfolds as a compassionate Brooklyn resident emerges as a hero, rescuing pigeons trapped within the confines of construction sites under the Brooklyn-Queens Expressway.

title: Owners of Graves Light clash in court over tax bill
brief: Embark on an enchanting journey through a feature photography series that delves into the lives of a captivating couple who have made the historical Graves Lighthouse in Hull, Massachusetts, their summer abode. Alongside the picturesque images, a compelling narrative unfolds, revealing their courtroom clash with the Hull township over the intriguing question of tax payments.

title: Cuddling baby farm animals in Carver brings peace to local visitors
brief: Discover the heartwarming tale of Phippen Pharm, a delightful local farm nestled in Carver, Massachusetts, where a farmer opens the gates of a petting wonderland for children to frolic and connect with animals. Published in prints, this endearing feature highlights the essence of local businesses and their commitment to fostering cherished memories in the community.

title: Milton remembers life of George Floyd 2 years after his death
brief: Powerful feature photography series capturing the vigil for George Floyd in Milton, Mass.

title: Young Photographer
brief: With the Mamiya 7 camera and Kodak Portra 400 film, I crafted three portrait series, each portraying young photographers curating their final exhibition for the Photo Practicum class at Emerson College.

title: Passenger
brief: Using the Canon 5D Mk II with a 70-200mm lens, I captured commuters within their cars, navigating the bustling streets of Packard's Corner in Allston, MA.
